selectedVerses.text: "And the king shall do as he wills. He shall exalt himself and magnify himself above every god, and shall speak astonishing things against the God of gods. He shall prosper till the indignation is accomplished; for what is decreed shall be done.
All these are empowered by one and the same Spirit, who apportions to each one individually as he wills.
So then he has mercy on whomever he wills, and he hardens whomever he wills.
But on taking leave of them he said, "I will return to you if God wills," and he set sail from Ephesus.
Instead you ought to say, "If the Lord wills, we will live and do this or that."
